word:
MR No. 961 - Looking Back at Minneapolis
[A WORKERS'
MEETING HELD IN MINNEAPOLIS FROM OCT. 10 TO 17, 1888, WAS
FOLLOWED BY THE GENERAL CONFERENCE SESSION, WHICH MET FROM
OCT. 17 TO NOV. 4.]

     It was by faith I ventured to cross the Rocky Mountains for the purpose of attending the General Conference held in Minneapolis. We left Oakland for Minneapolis, Minnesota, October 2. A number of friends were on the same train and it was a pleasure for me to visit with them, but it was too much for my strength. I needed entire rest. I had a spasm of the heart that night and for several hours I suffered much with exhaustion. This illness so prostrated me that I was obliged, because of severe pain in my heart, to keep my berth nearly all the time through the entire journey.
